data.title: Why do States have so many counties?
data.meta_description: Answer (1 of 3): Historically, the boundaries for a county were anywhere within a dayâ€™s walk from the county seat, the largest city in the county where a lot of the county services are (like the courthouse and the mayor). This led to there being a lot of counties.
